page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Westbury-on-Severn Village is situated on the A48 road some ten miles west of Gloucester and boasts one shop, one pub, the church and the parish hall. The parish of Westbury is one of the largest in England - by area, that is, not population. It is bordered on one side by the River Severn and to the south west is the Royal Forest of Dean. The other main areas of population are the village of Flaxley and Popes Hill. The parish is served by various 'vans' - baker, butcher, greengrocer, fishmonger. There is also a School bus service, travelling library and a mobile Health Service Chiropodist. There is no industry in the area which is mainly farm land, dairy and sheep farming being predominant.
